He maneuvers just over the rocks, almost making a 90 degree turn. He looks back at the rocks in disbelief.  But the lift doesn't last long. He quickly CRASHES, landing HARD into a snowbank. dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ben -- BEN Oh, you remember my name do you?  You happen to remember what you swore to do with every breath in your body?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, this is nothing.

dialogue.raw_text: Glad "nothing" could take you away from your work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

His screens flicker with static -- he's too close, but he can't pull back.  He sees: REED TURNS ON THE MACHINE.  Hits a countdown. And he grabs his UNIFORM...

dialogue.raw_text: I am looking.  That's why I can't make a mistake!  I've got to get it right, and it's not right yet!  We need to test this.

dialogue.raw_text: Ben!  Stop it!  Or I'll stop it.

dialogue.raw_text: Stay out of this Susie.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm OK.  Just go, go after him.  Stop him.

So you can stop talking to me like I'm your little boy -- SUE As soon as you stop acting like one. Come on, you're smarter than this. You think those people out there care about you?  You're just a fad to them.

direction.raw_text: Victor sits enthralled.  He leans forward, breathless.

direction.raw_text: Reed gets closer.  His heart races.  So does Victor's.  A moment of truth for both of them.  REED STEPS INTO THE MACHINE. Reed looks up at the cosmic storm.  He opens his arms, ready to risk his life.  And...WHHHM!  He JOLTS in JUMP-CUT-MOTION, RECONFIGURING, JERKING out of control, and we CUT TO -- VICTOR'S OFFICE - NIGHT His screens GO BLACK.  He looks out the window to see...a flash atop the BAXTER BUILDING.  The tip of the Baxter glows. The rest of its lights GO OUT, FLICKERING in a power surge.

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh god, Reed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

Reed SLUMPS TO THE GROUND.  His eyes flutter back.  Dead...? His body is warped, twisted -- one half remains tense, hard, while the other half is loose, soft, almost melted.

dialogue.raw_text: What did you do, Reed?  What did you do?

dialogue.raw_text: I can...make it work.

direction.raw_text: where we see JOHNNY sitting in a cozy VIP section. He's surrounded by "groupies" climbing over each other to get a look at his various parlour tricks. He leans closer to a YOUNG WOMAN.  Closer.  Candles around them start to melt.  Beads of sweat drip down her face.

dialogue.raw_text: What do you say we get out of here?

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : Victor initiates the transformation sequence.  As lights go on inside the chamber, they dim in the lab.  Energy pumps into the chamber.  The storm swirls faster.  Lights flicker...there's not enough power, until -- -- Victor walks over...grabs hold of the machine with both hands...and WHHHM!  A countdown begins in the control panels. SLOW MOVE IN on the chamber, The Thing's face in the window. The chamber activates.  The storm strikes hard. The Thing opens his mouth, a beat, then he screams in agony. Struggling violently inside.  To escape?  Extend the moment: Condensation obscures the chamber window: The Thing vanishes.

direction.raw_text: the RED CLOUD swirls with debris, crackling with light.  The chamber rattles dangerously, as the power seems to SHAKE the very foundation of the building. And then it's over.  The light dies down...somewhat.  It still pulses along with the chamber.  The chamber door SLIDES OPEN. Beat.  And...BEN GRIMM steps out.  Not The Thing.  No more rocks.  BEN GRIMM.  Naked, tired, but finally A NORMAL MAN. He slips on his trench-coat -- now way too large.  He collapses.  He stares at his hands, his arms...it worked.
